item.title: About me
item.description: Intro Experienced and accomplished business/system analyst in technology environments. Master Certification from Schulich Executive Education Centre in Business Analysis. Expertise in transformation- enhancement and maintenance projects. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Skilled in inception, elaboration and implementation of computer systems (web/mobile). Ability to manage teams and prioritize tasks in a rapidly changing environment. Expertise: Presentation Leadership Business Analysis SDLC Agile / Scrum / Waterfall Elicitation Interviews JAD sessions User Stories Wire Frames & Mock-ups UML Diagrams Data Modeling Flowcharts Process Flows Web development iOS development APIs development SQL Python HTML JIRA/Confluence HPQC MS Visio MS Office

item.title: An Approach to Style
item.description: I can’t recall what made me borrow this book from my local library: The Elements of Style, by William Strunk Jr. and E.B. White. On “An approach to style” section I’ve found a couple of interesting rules that struck a chord, as those are things we, business analysts, should have in mind while communicating our work to others. Be clear Clarity is not the prize in writing, nor is it always the principal mark of a good style.
